Class DynamicKeyUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pranavpandey.android.dynamic.key.util.DynamicKeyUtils

extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to perform key related operations.

                                Context context,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.String targetPackage)
        Matches the signature of two packages.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to get the package manager.
        targetPackage - The package to be matched.
        Returns:
        true if the signature of two packages match.
        See Also:
        PackageManager.checkSignatures(String, String), PackageManager.SIGNATURE_MATCH

        Parameters:
        context - The context to be used.
        packages - The key packages to be matched.
        Returns:

      • rateAppOrKey

        public static boolean rateAppOrKey​(@Nullable
                                   Context context,
                                   boolean isKey,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String keyPackage)
        Rate the app or key (if installed) on the Google Play.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to get the package name.
        isKey - true if the key package is installed.
        keyPackage - The key package to be rated.
        Returns:
        true on successful operation.
        See Also:
        DynamicLinkUtils.rateApp(Context), DynamicLinkUtils.viewInGooglePlay(Context, String)

      • checkWithBase

        public static int checkWithBase​(@Nullable
                                Context context,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.String base,
                                boolean debug,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.String... packages)
        Checks whether the signature matches for at least one of the supplied packages and sets the shared preferences accordingly.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to be used.
        base - The optional base key to be used.
        debug - true if running in debug mode.
        packages - The key packages to be matched.
        Returns:
        The key status according to the installed packages.
